alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 8:44PM CDT until May 29 at 11:48PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Driftwood Creek Near McCook 4sw affecting Red Willow County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Nebraska...Kansas... Republican River At Mccook 1se affecting Red Willow County. Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County. Beaver Creek At Cedar Bluffs affecting Decatur and Red Willow Counties. .Flooding continues to be a threat for much of Southwest Nebraska and far Northwest Kansas. Another round of rainfall is approaching the warning area from the west. If additional heavy rainfall occurs, that may lead to another minor rise in river stages late tonight or some time Saturday, especially in Southwest Nebraska. For the Frenchman Creek...including Culbertson...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Lowland areas near the vicinity of the gage will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Friday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM CDT Friday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.9 feet on 08/09/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 845 AM CDT.
